creator: petr.sumbera@oracle.com
text:
To get full support for large files for 32bit application one need to define:

-D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64

And this should be the same for Linux:

http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Feature-Test-Macros.html

It's unclear to me why configure adds just -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
This is invalid for APR 1.5.x as it breaks the ABI, which is why it wasn't already done.  This is also why Solaris-bundled httpd+APR is busted for modules built for normal builds.

I don't know if this is resolved with APR 2.0, which is the point at which this could change.  If it doesn't do the right thing already, bring it up on the dev@apr mailing list or reopen this bug with HEAD as the version.
